title: Arthur Horan
text:
Arthur Horan (13 October 1886 - 15 January 1970) was an <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> <a href="scrum-half%20%28rugby%20union%29">scrum-half</a> who won two caps for the <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland national rugby team</a> in 1920. 
He made his debut on 14 February 1920 against <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> (one of 11 Irish debutants that day), with his final appearance for the side coming on 13 March 1920 against <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales</a>. He was born in <a href="London%20Borough%20of%20Hackney">Hackney</a>, <a href="London">London</a> and died in <a href="Lewisham">Lewisham</a>.
